title.bold: Color-enhanced electron micrograph of Ebola virus particles.

abstract.p: Ebola virus causes severe hemorrhagic fever in humans and nonhuman primates, with case fatality rates often exceeding 80% (see Geisbert et al., doi:10.1371/journal.ppat.1000225).

p.italic: Image Credit: Thomas W. Geisbert, Boston University School of Medicine

title.bold: Color-enhanced electron micrograph of Ebola virus particles.

caption.p: Ebola virus causes severe hemorrhagic fever in humans and nonhuman primates, with case fatality rates often exceeding 80% (see Geisbert et al., doi:10.1371/journal.ppat.1000225).

p.italic: Image Credit: Thomas W. Geisbert, Boston University School of Medicine

fig.attrib: Geisbert TW, Daddario-DiCaprio KM, Lewis MG, Geisbert JB, Grolla A, et al. (2008) Vesicular Stomatitis Virus-Based Ebola Vaccine Is Well-Tolerated and Protects Immunocompromised Nonhuman Primates. PLoS Pathog 4(11): e1000225. doi:10.1371/journal.ppat.1000225
